title: William Lane Craig REACTS to Carl Sagan's "Sharpest Arguments Against Religion"
description:
Although Carl Sagan didn't personally identify as an atheist, many atheists today revere what he had to say about religion. In this video, I'm joined by Dr. William Lane Craig to take a closer look at some of Sagan's "sharpest arguments against religion."

Carl Sagan was an American astronomer and science communicator. Sagan was a popular public advocate of skeptical scientific inquiry and the scientific method; he pioneered the field of exobiology and promoted the search for extra-terrestrial intelligent life (SETI).

title: Do the Gospels Contain Eyewitness Testimony? | The Historical Tell | Episode 1
description:
In this 5-part documentary, we explore one of the most contested claims in the Bible, namely, that Luke used eyewitness testimony in crafting his Gospel. Join us as we explore ground-breaking research that might just prove that Luke was telling the truth.

In episode 1, we provide an overview of the case for eyewitness testimony in the Gospels and, in doing so, touch on the question of whether the Gospels were written anonymously.

To access the full, unedited interviews with all of the scholars featured in this documentary, become a supporter here: https://www.patreon.com/posts/95286759

For a thorough treatment of the alleged anonymity of the Gospels, see Simon Gathercole's article: https://academic.oup.com/jts/article-abstract/69/2/447/5101372

To purchase Luuk Van De Weghe's book "The Historical Tell," visit his website: https://www.luukvandeweghe.com/

title: Defending Pro-Life ft. Trent Horn and Legal Expert Samuel Green (he helped overturn RvW!)
description:
In this livestream, I'm joined by Catholic apologist Trent Horn and Pro-Life advocate Samuel Green to discuss ab0rtion and the Church.

Samuel Green serves as President & General Counsel at Reason for Life, a nonprofit ministry working to end abortion in America. Samuel shares about the biblical and scientific case for cherishing and defending children in the womb by delivering sermons at churches, presenting chapel messages at Christian schools, and providing pro-life education in other capacities. He also engages in pro-life advocacy in the legal arena and filed one of the many friend-of-the-court briefs in the U.S. Supreme Court case that overturned Roe v. Wade.

Trent Horn is a Catholic apologist and speaker at Catholic Answers. He has a thriving YouTube channel here: @TheCounselofTrent

title: You. Yes, you. Do you believe in reincarnation? WATCH THIS!
description:

Seth Hart is a PhD candidate in Science and Religion at Durham University. He holds a graduate degree in Science and Religion from the University of Oxford, where he served as a Clarendon Scholar. He cohosts the podcast Spiritually Incorrect.

title: What People Get Wrong about Slavery in Ancient Egypt
description:
In this interview, Dr. David Falk lays out several lines of archaeological evidence that support a real Exodus event as recorded in the Bible.

Dr. David A. Falk holds three master's degrees and a Ph.D. in Egyptology from the University of Liverpool, and is a research associate at the Vancouver School of Theology.  He studies ancient Egypt and the Bible, and in 2020 published the book "The Ark of the Covenant in its Egyptian Context: An Illustrated Journey."

Dr. Falk's website: http://www.egyptandthebible.com/

title: AI Consciousness, the Soul, & God's Existence w/ Eric Hernandez
description:
In this live interview, I sit down with Eric Hernandez, an experienced Christian apologist, to discuss his thoughts on AI--whether AI will ever become conscious--and what that means for Christianity. We also discuss his work on dualism and reflect on some of the craziest debates he's had with atheists.

Eric Hernandez is a dynamic evangelist and apologist with a heart for proclaiming the gospel and defending the faith on theological and philosophical grounds. He‚Äôs a licensed minister, a certified formation therapist, and the Apologetics Lead and Millennial Specialist for The Baptist General Convention of Texas. He holds an associate degree in social science, a bachelor‚Äôs degree in theology, and a certificate in apologetics from Biola University.

title: Do We Ever Experience Anything Begin to Exist? The Mereological Nihilism Objection to the Kalam
description:
There's a common objection to the Kalam Cosmological Argument that goes something like this: we never actually experience anything beginning to exist, we only ever experience new arrangements of pre-existing material. Hence, since we don't experience things really beginning to exist, the Kalam's causal principle is left unsupported. In this episode, I'm joined by Dr. Justin Mooney, a philosopher specializing in mereology (the study of part-whole relations) to discuss whether this objection has any merit.

The argument for God from psychophysical harmony is one of the latest (and strongest) theistic arguments. One of the issues with the argument, however, is that it can be a bit difficult to understand. In this video, I'm joined by Dr. Brian Cutter (one of the paper's authors) to explain this argument in a way that is accessible and easy to understand.

title: Christianity and Mental Health w/ Neuroscientist Nii Addy
description:
In this livestream, I'm joined by neuroscientist Dr. Nii Addy to discuss the intersection between Christianity and mental health issues.

Dr. Nii Addy is the Albert E. Kent Professor of Psychiatry at the Yale School of Medicine,
where he directs a research lab investigating the neurobiological bases of substance use
disorders, depression and anxiety. Dr. Addy also contributes to graduate student and postdoctoral
training, faculty development and diversity, equity and inclusion programs and initiatives on
campus and in professional scientific societies. In addition, he hosts the Addy Hour podcast,
discussing topics at the intersection of neuroscience, mental health, faith, culture and social
justice.

title: Twitter vs. The Argument from Persons to God (w/ Dr. Josh Rasmussen)
description:
In this livestream, Dr. Josh Rasmussen and I discuss Twitter responses to the following argument:

(1) There are persons.
(2) If reality is not fundamentally personal, there would very likely not be any persons.
(3) If reality is fundamentally personal, it's not nearly as unlikely that there would be persons.
(4) Therefore, the existence of persons is evidence for reality being fundamentally personal.

Dr. Rasmussen's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/WorldviewDesignChannel

title: Investigating the Eliakim Typological Argument for the Papacy w/ Dr. Daniel Vecchio
description:
Br. Suan Sonna has defended an argument for the papacy wherein Peter (Matt 16:19) is said to be the typological fulfillment of Eliakim from Is 22:22. In this episode, I sit down with Catholic philosopher Daniel Vecchio to investigate this argument at a deeper level.

3 Months FREE at Hallow: https://www.hallow.com/capturingchristianity

Daniel Vecchio is an Assistant Professor of Philosophy and Religious Studies at Victor Valley College, a community college northeast of Los Angeles in the "High Desert".  He received his doctorate in Philosophy from Marquette University in 2016 where he developed an interpretive model for understanding Aristotle's modal logic.  Daniel and his wife Gabriela are "cradle" Roman Catholics who are raising their daughter and son in the faith.

title: Dr. Craig Responds to His Atheist Critics
description:
Dr. William Lane Craig recently claimed that he wants to lower the "epistemic standards" for Christian belief. His comments have sparked outrage in the atheist community. Some atheists have even claimed that his comments totally discredit his work more generally. In this video, Dr. Craig explains how his comments are completely in line with current philosophical thinking on pragmatic/epistemic rationality.

Link to original comments from Dr. Craig: https://www.reasonablefaith.org/media/reasonable-faith-podcast/questions-on-quantum-mechanics-certainty-and-extreme-resistance

title: Are Atheists in Denial About Fine-Tuning? w/ Dr. Philip Goff
description:
Dr. Philip Goff recently tweeted the following: "The theist is in denial about suffering. The atheist is in denial about fine-tuning. The endless ideological war between these two factions is preventing us finding a theory that can accommodate both of these data." In this episode, I invite Dr. Goff to explain some of the ideas behind his tweet.

The culprit: https://twitter.com/Philip_Goff/status/1531923574071738373?s=20&t=EQq9LyAErLiZXVnt-bPm3w

Dr. Goff's blog post on why the multiverse can't explain fine-tuning: https://conscienceandconsciousness.com/2022/06/08/why-the-multiverse-cant-explain-fine-tuning/

Philip Goff's website: https://philipgoffphilosophy.com
Philip Goff's twitter: https://twitter.com/Philip_Goff
US version of Philip Goff's book 'Galileo's Error: Foundations for a New Science of Consciousness': https://penguinrandomhouse.com/books/599229/galileos-error-by-philip-goff/
UK version of Philip Goff's book 'Galileo's Error: Foundations for a New Science of Consciousness': https://penguin.co.uk/books/111/1117019/galileo-s-error/9781846046018.html

title: A New Argument for Christianity? w/ Dr. Gavin Ortlund
description:
In this video, Dr. Gavin Ortlund lays out C. S. Lewis' famous 'Liar, Lunatic, or Lord' trichotomy. This is actually a really fun argument to think about. If it works, it's another way to know that (a) God exists, and (b) Christianity is true.

See Dr. Ortlund's book here: https://www.amazon.com/Makes-Sense-World-That-Doesnt/dp/1540964094/

title: Who is the Rock? (Matt 16:18) // Jimmy Akin vs. Dr. Steven Nemes [Full Video]
description:
Matt 16:18 is the famous passage that says: "And I tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not overcome it." The question that will be discussed in this dialogue is who the rock is referring to. Does it refer to Peter? To Jesus? To someone/something else?

Dr. Nemes' YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/DrStevenNemes
Jimmy Akin's channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/JimmyAkin

title: Sijuwade & Oppy Discuss Grounding & God (feat. William Hasker & Susana Gomez)
description:
In his Philosophy of Religion class at Huntington University, Dr. Tedla Woldayohnnes invited Dr. Joshua Sijuwade to present his essay, "Grounding and the Existence of God" with a response from Prof. Graham Oppy. Prof. William Hasker and Dr. Susana G√≥mez were also participants in the discussion.

As for the format of this video, it opens with a 50-minute presentation from Dr. Sijuwade of his argument to the class, followed by a 50-minute dialogue between Sijuwade, Oppy, Hasker, and Gomez. Btw, sorry in advance for the poor quality of audio at times, Zoom certainly has its limits. In any case, please enjoy!

Dr. Sijuwade's paper on Grounding and the Existence of God: https://philarchive.org/archive/SIJGAT

title: The Case FOR the Papacy w/ Joe Heschmeyer
description:
In this livestream, I'm joined by Joe Heschmeyer to discuss his case for the papacy. Why is the papacy so important? Well, if it's true, then Catholicism is true. If it's false, then Catholicism is false. It's one of Catholicism's most distinctive doctrines.

Joe's book "Pope Peter": https://www.amazon.com/Pope-Peter-Defending-Distinctive-Doctrine/dp/1683571800/ref=sr_1_1?crid=8TB2LFA2CI5H&keywords=pope+peter&qid=1648475430&sprefix=pope+pet%252Caps%252C87&sr=8-1&_encoding=UTF8&tag=cc08b9-20&linkCode=ur2&linkId=3022ab4c683798be562ddd2cd3d4572f&camp=1789&creative=9325

description:
Progressive Christianity Explained in 60 Seconds

Full Video: https://youtu.be/oQ6doQsSQLU

title: Is Fine-Tuning Evidence for a Multiverse? (No)
description:
In this interview, I'm joined by Dr. Philip Goff, an agnostic professor, to discuss a particular fallacy of reasoning that occurs when physicists infer that a multiverse exists due to the fine-tuning of the cosmos.

Philip Goff is an Associate Professor of Philosophy at Durham University, and co-host of the podcast Mind Chat. Goff‚Äôs main research focus is consciousness, but he is interested in many questions about the nature of reality. Goff is most known for defending panpsychism, the view that consciousness is a fundamental and ubiquitous feature of the physical world. Goff has authored an academic book with Oxford University Press ‚Äì Consciousness and Fundamental Reality ‚Äì and a book aimed at a general audience ‚Äì Galileo's Error: Foundations for a New Science of Consciousness. He is currently working on a book exploring the middle ground between God and atheism. Goff has published 45 academic articles as well as writing extensively for newspapers and magazines, including Scientific American, The Guardian, Aeon and the Times Literary Supplement. The interview with Goff by Pulitzer Prize winning author Gareth Cook was one of the most viewed of the most viewed articles in Scientific American of 2020. 

https://twitter.com/Philip_Goff 
https://www.youtube.com/c/MindChat
https://www.philipgoffphilosophy.com/ 
https://www.amazon.com/Galileos-Error-Foundations-Science-Consciousness/dp/0525564772

title: Atheist prays. God answers.
description: To see the full interview: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ca7DfssJ5kE

title: The Most Honest Q&A on the Problem of Evil You May Ever Watch
description:
Daniel Speak (Ph.D., University of California, Riverside) is Professor of Philosophy at Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles, California. He specializes in metaphysics (especially the metaphysics of free will) and the philosophy of religion. He also has research and teaching interests in ethics and epistemology. His book The Problem of Evil was published in 2014 by Polity Press. In addition, he is the co-editor (with Kevin Timpe) of Free Will and Theism, a collection of essays focused on central issues of overlap between the philosophy of religion and the philosophy of action (Oxford University Press, 2016). He has published chapters or articles in The Oxford Handbook of Free Will (2nd Edition), Faith and Philosophy, Res Philosophica, The Philosophical Quarterly, Religious Studies, The Routledge Companion to Free Will, and (as they say) elsewhere.

Feel free to follow him at: https://lmu.academia.edu/DanielSpeak

4 more problem of evil interviews with Dr. Speak on @TheAnalyticChristian: 
https://youtu.be/rHFz32kkEGA
https://youtu.be/lYY0g0jCRmY
https://youtu.be/icip4GjaMXs
https://youtu.be/qaxi5pxsD-Y

title: Has @CosmicSkeptic Found Christianity's Biggest Problem? (Response)
description:
In this video, I respond to Cosmic Skeptic's video "Christianity's Biggest Problem."

Alex's original video: https://youtu.be/5KDnnp0sDkI

DESCRIPTION #1:
The example Grandin cites comes from a book on this, Antoinio R. Damasio "Descartes' Error: Emotion, Reason and the Human Brain." And she also cites for the chapter as a whole  "Freeman, W., and J.W. Watts. 1950. 'Psychosurgery in the Treatment of Mental Disorders and Intractable Pain.' Springfield, IL: Charles C. Thomas Publisher."

Also, just as a general rule, if you just google leucotomies and pain you'll find all kinds of stuff on this connection between leucotomy patients and people reporting reduced suffering. They did leucotomies in the 50s and 60s and they were way weird.

DESCRIPTION #2:
‚ÄúA hypothesis h suffers from probabilistic tension if and only if h is logically equivalent to some conjunctive hypothesis, h1& h2, such that either P(h1| h2) is [greatly lesser than] 1 or P(h2| h1) is [greatly lesser than] 1: that is, one conjunct of the hypothesis is very unlikely, conditioned on the other conjunct. Among other things, a hypothesis h that suffers from probabilistic tension will be very unlikely: since P(h) = P(h1& h2) = P(h1| h2) x P(h2) = P(h2| h1) x P(h1), it follows that if P(h1| h2) is [greatly lesser than] 1 or P(h2| h1) is [greatly lesser than] 1, then P(h) is [greatly lesser than] 1.‚Äù In our case, atheism represents h. If h is really the conjunction of Atheism & Evolution, as Alex assumes, then we can represent Atheism as h1 and Evolution as h2. Since the probability of Evolution on Atheism is very unlikely, the probability of h2 given h1 is also very unlikely. Following Collins, this leads us to conclude that the intrinsic probability of h is very unlikely.

DESCRIPTION #3:
BOOKS:
-Animal Suffering and the Darwinian Problem of Evil by John Schneider 
-God, Evolution and Animal Suffering by Bethany Sollereder
-The Groaning of Creation: God, Evolution and the Problem of Evil by Christopher Southgate
-Animal Suffering and the Problem of Evil by Nicola Hoggard Creegan
-Thomism and the Problem of Animal Suffering by Kyle Keltz
DISSERTATIONS:
-The Problem of Evil and Animal Suffering: A Case Study by Faith Pawl
-All Creation Groans: A Theodicy for Suffering Animals by Matthew Douglass
OTHER RESOURCES:
-The Problem of Evil by Peter van Inwagen (has a chapter on animal pain)
-A Random-Based Theodicy for Evolutionary Evils by Josh Rasmussen and J. Wesling
-Certain global theodicies: e.g. skeptical theism, multiverse models, etc.

DESCRIPTION #4:
Why Didn't God Just Create Everyone in Heaven?? - https://youtu.be/kOmOLre6CyM

DESCRIPTION #5:
http://dustincrummett.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/philosophy-of-religion-for-all-final-version-4-13-2019-1.pdf

DESCRIPTION #6:
There aren't a lot of arguments for the conclusion that animals are essentially non-rational, and the ones that exist are not very good.


Special thanks to Wade Tisthammer (@Maverick Christian), Justin Mooney, Joe Schmid (@Majesty of Reason), Josh Rasmussen (@Worldview Design), Dustin Crummett, & Liz Jackson (@PhiLizophy) for providing helpful comments on earlier drafts of the script.

00:00 Introduction
00:47 4 Caveats
07:08 Section 1 - Animal Suffering & Atheism
16:34 Section 2 - Animal Suffering & Christianity
36:08 Section 3 - My Current Verdict

title: Is Christ's Nature Contradictory? James Anderson vs. Jc Beall
description:
In this informal discussion, Jc Beall and James Anderson discuss the nature of Christ. Is Christ's nature contradictory?

Dr. Jc Beall is a philosopher that specializes in the philosophy of logic. He is currently a professor of philosophy at the University of Notre Dame. Beall is also widely known for advocating a glut-theoretic account of logic (a non-classical approach).

Dr. James Anderson specializes in philosophical theology, religious epistemology, and Christian apologetics. His doctoral thesis at the University of Edinburgh explored the paradoxical nature of certain Christian doctrines and the implications for the rationality of Christian faith.

title: Strong Evidence for Reincarnation? // Seth Hart vs. Arjuna Gallagher
description:
In this informal debate, Seth Hart (Christian) engages Arjuna Gallagher (non-Christian) on the strength of the evidence for reincarnation. In case you didn't know, LOTS of ink has been spilled in academia on this subject. In this debate, we focus in on a couple landmark studies.

Seth Hart is a PhD student in science and theology at the University of Durham. He holds masters in theology from Oxford, Regent College, and Johnson University. His current research delves into whether the field of biology and its fundamental concepts are built upon theistic foundations, arguing that terms like ‚Äúadaptation‚Äù, ‚Äúorganism‚Äù, and ‚Äúfitness‚Äù all entail the existence of God. Seth is also a regular contributor on the Capturing Christianity blog.

Arjuna is a Hare Krishna, electrician and YouTuber. He runs the YouTube channel Theology Unleashed, which seeks to bring Hare Krishna (Caitanya Vaishnava) perspective to the philosophy of religion YouTube dialogue. He lives in New Zealand with his wife and 2 young boys.

Arjuna's YouTube channel: https://youtube.com/c/TheologyUnleashed

title: No. A Thoughtful Case for Communion as a Symbolic Meal
description:
In this video, I'm joined by my friend Dr. Steven Nemes who defends a view that says the Communion (or the Lord's Supper) is a Memorial Meal. Over the course of just an hour, Steven and I look at the "My Body" passages in the synoptics, the Bread of Life Discourse in John, what the Early Church Fathers had to say about the Eucharist, and the Magisterium.

Dr. Nemes' channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/DrStevenNemes
Dr. Nemes' discussion with Suan Sonna on the Magisterium: https://youtu.be/8VOiacvrX4g

title: 2 Christian Experts Respond to COVID-19 Vaccine Skepticism
description:
There's a considerable amount of skepticism of the COVID-19 vaccines in the Christian community. Is this skepticism warranted? What's the evidence? In this livestream, I'm joined by biochemist Sy Garte and immunologist James Ussher, both Christians, to discuss common objections to the COVID vaccines.

Sy's original video: https://youtu.be/03dl8T_h5O8

Study on Vaccine Immunity vs. Natural Immunity mentioned by Dr. Garte: https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/70/wr/pdfs/mm7032e1-H.pdf

0:00:00 Introduction
0:05:27 1 - Vaccine Skeptic on Channel?
0:09:53 2 - Mandate Issue?
0:11:23 3 - Slanted Incentive Structure?
0:15:32 4 - Vaccine immunity vs. Natural Immunity
0:22:36 5 - Already had COVID, still need vaccine?
0:24:32 6 - No long-term studies, therefore skepticism?
0:37:38 7 - COVID vaccines and heart-related issues
0:38:32 8 - Aborted fetal cells used in production of vaccines?
0:46:51 9 - Young people should reject vaccine?
0:49:51 10 - What about all the breakout cases?
0:58:23 11 - Approval process for COVID vaccines?
1:03:22 12 - Do vaccines reduce transmission rate?
1:06:59 Outroduction

title: Is Christianity Sexist? Women's Ordination in the Bible
description:
In this interview, I'm joined by Nick Quient, a PhD student in New Testament, to discuss the issue of the ordination of women in the Bible. Is Christianity sexist?

Nick Quient is a PhD candidate in New Testament at Ridley College in Melbourne, AU. He also earned an MA in New Testament from Fuller Theological Seminary and a BA from Biola University. He has published in the Canadian-American Theological Review, Priscilla Papers, and the Evangelical Review of Theology and is the author of ‚ÄúThe Perfection of Our Faithful Wills‚Äù (Wipf & Stock, 2019). He is an ordained Baptist pastor serving in Southern California.

#Christian #Atheist #Debate

title: Catholic/Protestant Debate: Is the Papacy Affirmed in the New Testament?
description:
In this formal debate, Suan Sonna (Catholic, left) and Gavin Ortlund (Protestant, right) discuss whether the Catholic teaching of the pope/papacy is affirmed in the New Testament.

Suan Sonna is a philosophy student at Kansas State University and a Baptist convert to Catholicism. Suan has two published papers: one on the presumption of innocence in Cornell University's LOGOS journal and another published in the Heythrop journal not only responding to Jerry Walls' objections to the papacy but providing a positive Biblical case for Vatican I papal theology. Suan is also the founder and head of the Facebook page, podcast, and YouTube channel "Intellectual Conservatism" which is dedicated to conserving ancient Christian morality, political theory, metaphysics, theology, and more! Suan's YT channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCNjkpXEwIdH-jD8mPJwu_g

Gavin Ortlund (PhD, Fuller Theological Seminary) serves as senior pastor of First Baptist Church of Ojai in Ojai, California. He is the author of several books, including Why God Makes Sense in a World That Doesn't: The Beauty of Christian Theism. He runs a YouTube channel called Truth Unites: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtWDnUokOD--s2aFxLT5uVA

title: Will Everyone Be Saved? Annihilationist (left) vs. Universalist (right)
description:
In this informal debate, Chris Date defends Annihilationism and Keith Giles defends Universalism.

Chris Date is a well-known evangelical Christian author, editor, blogger, podcaster, debater, and speaker. Representing a global movement known as Rethinking Hell, Chris has published three articles in academic journals and two books on the topic of hell, including Rethinking Hell: Readings in Evangelical Conditionalism, and A Consuming Passion: Essays on Hell and Immortality in Honor of Edward Fudge. Chris is also an Adjunct Professor of Bible and Theology at Trinity College of the Bible and Theological Seminary.

Keith Giles is a former pastor who abandoned the pulpit to follow Jesus and ended up founding a church where 100% of the offering is given away to help the poor in the community. He is the author of several best-selling books including "Jesus Undefeated: Condemning The False Doctrine Of Eternal Torment". He has appeared on CNN and was recently interviewed by USA Today, BuzzFeed, and John Fugelsang's "Tell Me Everything." He also co-hosts the insanely popular Heretic Happy Hour podcast and the new Peace Catalyst Podcast.  He lives with his wife, Wendy, in El Paso, Texas.

Keith's book "Jesus Undefeated: Condemning The False Doctrine Of Eternal Torment": https://www.amazon.com/Jesus-Undefeated-Condemning-Doctrine-Eternal-ebook/dp/B07ZHP2T6G/ref=tmm_kin_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&qid=&sr=
Keith's blog on Patheos: https://www.patheos.com/blogs/keithgiles/
Keith's podcast: https://heretichappyhour.com/

Rethinking Hell Website: https://rethinkinghell.com/
Rethinking Hell YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/rethinkinghell

title: Is Social Media the END of Critical Thinking? feat. Dr. Paul, a TikTok Philosopher
description:
Dr. Paul Blaschko is a TikTok philosopher--he makes awesome and hilarious TikTok videos on various philosophical topics, exposing thousands of people to deep philosophical questions. In this interview, we discuss the role of social media in Christian education and philosophy.

Paul's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxgkx_t6mkkBE-iN_MUyaTg
Paul's TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@profblaschko?lang=en
A course he teaches at Notre Dame that is heavily "digitally integrated," contains some social elements and is the project out of which most of his engagement with social media grows out of: https://godandgoodlife.nd.edu/
A recent Substack post where Paul lays out his vision re: education and social media: https://paulblaschko.substack.com/p/shallowbrained 
A book Paul co-authored, coming out Jan. 4th based on the above class and -- in a different medium -- attempts to accomplish the same sort of aim as the social media stuff: https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/624476/the-good-life-method-by-meghan-sullivan-and-paul-blaschko/

title: Is the Gospel of John Historically Reliable? (Dr. Lydia McGrew)
description:
Dr. Lydia McGrew is a widely published analytic philosopher and author. She received her PhD in English from Vanderbilt University in 1995. She has published extensively in the theory of knowledge, specializing in formal epistemology and in its application to the evaluation of testimony and to the philosophy of religion. She defends the reliability of the Gospels and Acts in her books Hidden in Plain View: Undesigned Coincidences in the Gospels and Acts, The Mirror or the Mask: Liberating the Gospels From Literary Devices, and most recently The Eye of the Beholder: The Gospel of John as Historical Reportage.

The Eye of the Beholder: The Gospel of John as Historical Reportage - https://amzn.to/3uZGbvp

Lydia's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSwhBk0vUSg_6prKkR82IDQ/videos

title: CLOSING STATEMENT - @CapturingChristianity vs. @rationalityrules
description:
Welcome to the Closing Statement of my debate against Rationality Rules on the Kalam Cosmological Argument.

DESCRIPTION #1:
Playlist of all videos in our debate: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL96Nl_XJhQEj6TzLq2gfRAOB3neFNe3Hm

DESCRIPTION #2:
Stephen's Original Video: https://youtu.be/5EVGkl7lj_4
Cam's Responses
Part 1: https://youtu.be/Hyu2KsLWreA
Part 2: https://youtu.be/49eCU_DqDjo
Part 3: https://youtu.be/OnLfmz2qNqM
Stephen's Response to Part 1: https://youtu.be/O4GmgZBuEMU

DESCRIPTION #3:
Infinity, Causation, and Paradox: https://amzn.to/34LqAVs

DESCRIPTION #4:
20 Peer-Reviewed Cosmological Arguments: https://youtu.be/lp83jusMkSA

00:00 Introduction
00:33 Section 1 - General Comments
07:04 Section 2 - Objections to (1)
10:05 Unsatisfiable Pair
22:33 Section 3 - Objections to (2)
32:52 Outroduction

Many thanks to the following people for providing helpful comments on earlier drafts of the script: Josh Rasmussen, Justin Mooney, Wade A. Tisthammer (aka Maverick Christian), Liz Jackson, Andrew Moon, & Joe Schmid.

I also want to mention how my thinking on Unsatisfiable Pair was shaped by conversations with Alex Pruss, Josh Rasmussen, and Rob Koons. Alex pressed on me the utter absurdity of some arrangements of activation times being okay while others weren't (when the only thing that's changing is how the clocks are set). Josh pressed the recombination principle route (see here: https://joshualrasmussen.blogspot.com/2021/02/how-to-break-grim-reaper-argument.html). Rob pointed out how Unsatisfiable Pair and Causal Finitism are not actually at odds (indeed, causal finitists have been pointing out the logical inconsistency of Benardette scenarios since the beginning). What I've produced here is a kind of synthesis of their views in a way that is both concise and convincing (to me).

title: Ask This Medical Doctor and Pro-Life Speaker Anything on Abortion!
description:
Calum Miller is a medical doctor and a Research Associate at the University of Oxford specialising in abortion policy. He has 15 published papers in philosophy and ethics and has been invited to speak on abortion around the world including with members of parliament in a variety of countries and on the BBC.

Stephanie Gray Connors is an international pro-life speaker who has spent 20 years travelling the world debating abortion doctors, university professors and others on the topic of abortion. In 2017, she gave a pro-life presentation at Google headquarters for their series "Talks at Google." Stephanie is author of the book Love Unleashes Life: Abortion & the Art of Communicating Truth, as well as her latest book, Start with What: 10 Principles for Thinking about Assisted Suicide.

title: 5 Arguments for God from Miracles, from Keener to McGrew
description:

title: Egyptologist Presents Very Strong Evidence for a REAL Exodus
description:
In this interview, Dr. David Falk lays out several lines of archeological evidence that support a real Exodus event as recorded in the Bible.

Dr. David A. Falk holds three master's degrees and a Ph.D. in Egyptology from the University of Liverpool, and is a research associate at the Vancouver School of Theology.  He studies ancient Egypt and the Bible, and in 2020 published the book "The Ark of the Covenant in its Egyptian Context: An Illustrated Journey."

Dr. Falk's website: http://www.egyptandthebible.com/

Dr. Falk's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCF1f7vTqonOIwaGU6DwTvjg

title: Did Jesus Rise from the Dead? A Dialogue Between Shabir Ally & Andrew Loke
description:
In this formal discussion, Christian philosopher Andrew Loke (left) and Muslim scholar Shabir Ally (right) discuss whether Jesus died and rose from the dead.

Dr. Shabir Ally holds a B.A. in Religious Studies from Laurentian University in Sudbury, Ontario, with a specialization in Biblical Literature. He also holds an M.A. and a Ph.D from the University of Toronto with a specialization in Quranic Exegesis (tafsir). He is the president of the Islamic Information & Dawah Centre International in Toronto where he functions as Imam. He travels internationally to represent Islam in public lectures and interfaith dialogues. He explains Islam on a weekly television program called Let the Quran Speak. Past episodes of this show can be seen online at: www.quranspeaks.com.

Andrew Loke (PhD, King‚Äôs College London) is Associate Professor in the Department of Religion and Philosophy at Hong Kong Baptist University. He is the author of The Origins of Divine Christology (Cambridge University Press), Investigating the Resurrection of Jesus Christ (Routledge), A Kryptic Model of the Incarnation (Routledge), God and Ultimate Origins (Springer Nature), and The Teleological and Kalam Cosmological Arguments Revisited (Springer Nature, forthcoming).

title: What is the Fate of the Lost in Hell? Chris Date vs. Clinton Wilcox
description:
In this informal debate, Chris Date and Clinton Wilcox discuss their opposing views on the fate of the unsaved. Chris believes in Conditional Immortality, the view that the unsaved will not live forever. Clinton believes in the Traditional view, that the unsaved will live forever in a state of conscious torment.

Chris' RethinkingHell website: https://rethinkinghell.com/

title: What is the BEST Moral Argument for God?
description:
In this joint interview, I'm joined by Dr. William Lane Craig and Dr. David Baggett to discuss the merits of different versions of the moral argument for God's existence.

To participate in the class that Dr. Craig and Dr. Baggett are teaching on the moral argument at HBU: hbu.edu/school-of-christian-thought/hts-go-deeper/

Description of class: Come study the moral argument for God with Dr. William Lane Craig and Dr. David Baggett. This is a two-week intensive course, meeting Mondays through Fridays, 3:00-5:00 PM, May 17-28, 2021. The course will meet on campus and remotely via Zoom. Anyone in the world can sign up to audit this class!

$280 Early Bird, $300 after the class begins

title: Over 100 Arguments for the Existence of God
description:
In this video, Dr. Chad McIntosh presents over 100 arguments for the existence of God. Each argument is presented in visual form followed by recommended sources for further research. At the end, we discuss what a similar list of arguments for atheism would look like (and what it would imply for the theistic list of arguments).

Link to slides: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1i7-6PKnoOK8EiiC1r-tt44mZK7o3nCsN2_QH_0TxxZU/edit?usp=sharing

title: Why Science & Secularism Come From Christianity
description:
In this interview, I chat with author Tom Holland about his book "Dominion: How the Christian Revolution Remade the World." In it, he argues that our morals and ethics are not universal but are instead the fruits of a very distinctive civilization. Concepts such as secularism, liberalism, science, and homosexuality are deeply rooted in a Christian seedbed.

To purchase Dominion: https://amzn.to/2Len1ki

title: Kalam Debate: @CapturingChristianity vs. @rationalityrules - Cam's Second Rebuttal
description:
Welcome to my Second Rebuttal in my debate against Rationality Rules on the Kalam Cosmological Argument.

DESCRIPTION #1:
Playlist of all videos in our debate: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL96Nl_XJhQEj6TzLq2gfRAOB3neFNe3Hm

DESCRIPTION #2:
Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy: https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/rationalism-empiricism/#Empi
Britannica Encyclopedia: https://www.britannica.com/topic/empiricism
Philosophy Basics: https://www.philosophybasics.com/branch_empiricism.html
ThoughtCo: https://www.thoughtco.com/philosophical-empiricism-2670590
Routledge Encyclopedia of Philosophy: https://www.rep.routledge.com/articles/thematic/empiricism/v-1
Encyclopedia[dot]com: https://www.encyclopedia.com/philosophy-and-religion/philosophy/philosophy-terms-and-concepts/empiricism
Oxford Reference: https://www.oxfordreference.com/view/10.1093/oi/authority.20110803095750220

DESCRIPTION #3:
More thoughts on scientism/empiricism: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1D_3RU7l5L9W0vrvL6-1faK2UWW1mOsXWFgKHzAsdQHY/edit?usp=sharing

DESCRIPTION #4:
All 3 of Stephen's examples are compatible with an eternal past and hence don't imply Causal Finitism.

DESCRIPTION #5:
The sequence of natural numbers in ascending order goes like {1, 2, 3, 4...} but you obviously can't reverse the order to have a "first" element precisely because there is no "last" element. The sequence of natural numbers is an actual infinite, like the set of all past years in an infinite past. The reason that the sequence of natural numbers can't be reversed has nothing to do with it being a potential infinite, in part because it's not a potential infinite.

DESCRIPTION #6:
For more on Inductive Generalization: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inductive_reasoning#Generalization

DESCRIPTION #7:
We have more than 5 senses: https://www.sensorytrust.org.uk/blog/how-many-senses-do-we-have

00:00 Introduction
00:32 Section 1 - General Comments
04:28 Section 2 - Objections to (1)
06:01 Stephen's 3 Initial Objections
12:19 Stephen's 2 New Objections
14:40 Section 2 - Objections to (2)
16:15 Demonstrating the Uncaused
17:36 Cop Out?
19:08 Defense of (13)?
24:48 Outroduction

Many thanks to the following people for providing helpful comments on earlier drafts of the script: Josh Rasmussen, Justin Mooney, Wade A. Tisthammer (aka Maverick Christian), Liz Jackson, Andrew Moon, & Joe Schmid.

Special thanks to Juan Tejada for his help animating this video! You're really talented, bro!

Minor corrections: At 4:51, premise (6) should read "finitism," not "fininitism." This correction applies to future iterations. At 12:09, premises (4) and (5) should read (4*) and (5*) respectively.

title: If Aliens Existed, Would that Invalidate Christianity?

In this stream, I'm joined by Christian philosophers Tyler McNabb and Chad McIntosh to discuss their joint work on this question.

Dr. McNabb's website: http://www.tylermcnabb.com/

title: Are We Really Living in the END TIMES?
description:
The Second Coming of Christ is prominent in the New Testament, yet few Christians are actively looking for Jesus' return. In this interview, I chat with Ian Hutchings, father of David Hutchings, about his book entitled "The Return of Jesus Christ, The Christian's (half-forgotten) Hope."

Following a career in Oxford as a languages lecturer, Ian retired to Leicestershire where he became Chairman of Trustees of Wycliffe Associates (UK) a charity which supported bible translation and now as MissionAssist, supports wider CHristian mission overseas.

title: Why Demons Probably Exist w/ Dr. Shandon Guthrie
description:
In this livestream, I talk with Dr. Shandon Guthrie about his rigorous philosophical defense of the reality of Christian demonology--in other words, Dr. Guthrie has arguments that the Christian depiction of Satan and his demons is real.

Dr. Shandon's book "Gods of this World: A Philosophical Discussion and Defense of Christian Demonology": https://amzn.to/2Xq2QTt

Shandon L. Guthrie holds a Ph.D in philosophy from Manchester Metropolitan University and is a visiting lecturer of philosophy at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas. Guthrie lectures and speaks around the country at venues including colleges, universities, and churches. He has also been a guest on a number of local and national radio shows and podcasts on a variety of topics involving philosophy and apologetics. He and his wife Michelle both live in Las Vegas, Nevada, with their three children.

title: Kalam Debate: @CapturingChristianity vs. @rationalityrules - Cam's First Rebuttal
description:
Welcome to my First Rebuttal in my debate against Rationality Rules on the Kalam Cosmological Argument.

Playlist of all videos in our debate: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL96Nl_XJhQEj6TzLq2gfRAOB3neFNe3Hm

DESCRIPTION #1:
Cam's Opening - https://youtu.be/ZD92WaNjJF8
Stephen's Opening - https://youtu.be/bdhDIGULJWY

DESCRIPTION #2:
For an explanation of undercutting and rebutting defeaters - https://iep.utm.edu/ep-defea/#SH6a

DESCRIPTION #3:
Source of quote - https://iep.utm.edu/fallibil/

DESCRIPTION #4:
Joe Schmid's YouTube Channel - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvWRKmcplBTYQS49AVGsLgw

DESCRIPTION #5:
'If x is imperfect, then x is limited' is logically equivalent to (by contraposition) 'If x is not limited, then x is perfect.'

For understanding contraposition - https://youtu.be/QHE4REPtjDw

DESCRIPTION #6:
Atheist philosophers like Dr. Graham Oppy, Dr. Wes Morriston, Dr. Alex Malpass, and many others, have attempted to respond to the Kalam Cosmological Argument in peer-reviewed journals. They wouldn't do that if the Kalam weren't worth taking seriously.

0:00 Introduction
0:55 Section 1 - General Remarks
1:57 Section 2 - Structure
4:05 Section 3 - Two Premises
4:13 Premise (1)
4:51 Contradictions are Possible?
6:32 Grim Messenger Paradox
9:03 Stephen's 1st Objection
9:48 Stephen's 2nd Objection
10:08 Stephen's 3rd Objection
11:42 Premise (2)
12:14 Refuting Scientism
14:12 Stephen's Category Error
16:13 Non-Sequitur?
18:44 3 Additional Arguments
19:54 Argument #1
21:03 Argument #2
21:55 Argument #3
26:09 Omnipotence Paradox?
28:13 Summary
31:10 Outroduction

Many thanks to the following people for providing helpful comments on earlier drafts of the script: Josh Rasmussen, Justin Mooney, Wade A. Tisthammer (aka Maverick Christian), Liz Jackson, Andrew Moon, Tomas Bogardus, & Joe Schmid.

For access to the transcript of this video: https://www.patreon.com/posts/rr-kalam-debate-41491326

title: The Argument From Beauty for God's Existence (Dr. Pruss Wilde Lecture)
description:

The Wilde Lectures have been given since 1911 and are among the most prestigious lectureships available to philosophers working in philosophy of religion. The video you‚Äôre about to see is the particular lecture he presented in which he provides an argument for God‚Äôs existence from Beauty. It‚Äôs amazing!

title: Toward a Defensible View of Sola Scriptura with Dr. John Peckham
description:
In this livestream, I chat with Dr. John Peckham about his work on Sola Scriptura. Sola Scriptura (by scripture alone in English) is a theological doctrine held by some Protestant Christian denominations that the Christian scriptures are the sole infallible source of authority for Christian faith and practice. Is Sola Scriptura Defensible?

title: What are Rules of Inference? w/ Logic Professor Tim McGrew
description:
In this video, professional logician Tim McGrew explains various rules of inference and how they relate to discussions about God's existence.

Dr. Timothy McGrew is Professor of Philosophy at Western Michigan University. A specialist in theory of knowledge, logic, probability theory, and the history and philosophy of science, Dr. McGrew has spoken at Oxford, MIT, and other universities as well as at many churches and seminaries across the United States and overseas. He has also engaged in public debates on the meaning of faith, the rationality of belief in miracles, and the historical reliability of the Gospels.

title: Alexander Pruss Presents a POWERFUL Argument for God (Stanford Lecture)
description:
The other day, I heard an AMAZING lecture from Dr. Pruss where he presents a cumulative case for God's existence using some of the latest developments in philosophy. I emailed him and asked if I could mirror it here and he said yes! Enjoy!

DESCRIPTION #1:
Alexander R. Pruss is a tenured Professor of Philosophy at Baylor University in Waco, Texas. He has a Ph.D in philosophy from the University of Pittsburgh, as well as a Ph.D in mathematics from the University of British Columbia. He blogs regularly at his personal website which I have linked in the description. I definitely recommend checking it out, btw. He posts almost every day.

Dr. Pruss' blog: http://alexanderpruss.blogspot.com/

title: Answering Questions on God, Science, and Mathematics
description:
In this 90-minute livestream, I'm joined by Dr. David Wilkinson and Dave Hutchings to answer YOUR questions on God, science, and mathematics.

Dr. David Wilkinson is Principal of St John‚Äôs College and Professor in the Department of Theology and Religion at Durham University. He lives in Newcastle with his wife Alison and has two grown up children. He is a writer and speaker on Christianity and Science not just in the UK but around the world. He has doctorates in astrophysics and theology and is a Fellow of the Royal Astronomical Society. He is a Methodist minister, and author of many books.

Dave Hutchings is a Physics teacher at Pocklington School near York, England. A Fellow of the Institute of Physics, he has written several books about the relationship between science and religion and speaks regularly on the topic around the country at conferences, schools, universities, and churches. David has also run multiple training events for science teachers, specializing in dealing with common misconceptions in the discipline. He lives in York with his wife and two young daughters.

Link to "God, Stephen Hawking, and the Multiverse": https://amzn.to/2UacTuV

Link to "Let There Be Science": https://amzn.to/3476G63

Link to "The Return of Jesus Christ": https://amzn.to/2w5ooKG

This is basically an overview of many philosophical puzzles brought about by the concept of prayer. If God knows what we will pray before we pray it, does it matter if we pray? Is God praiseworthy even though He didn't choose to be Good?

Dr. Davison's website: http://scottdavison.webstarts.com/

title: Neil deGrasse Tyson Wants Evidence? Here Are 3 Things that PROVE God Exists
description:
Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson thinks there's no evidence for God. In this video, I provide 3 solid pieces of evidence that together confirm God's existence.

Description #1 [03:46] - This is a free copy (taken from his website) of Dr. Robin Collins essay on Fine-Tuning that was published in the Blackwell Companion to Natural Theology. In section 2.3.2 he explains where the 10^60 calculation comes from for the fine-tuning of gravity. http://home.messiah.edu/~rcollins/Fine-tuning/Abridged%20Version%20of%20Fine-tuning%20book.doc

Description #2 [04:21] - My interview with cosmologist Dr. Luke Barnes detailing loads of evidence for fine-tuning: https://youtu.be/58brbYwN0Q0

Description #3 [04:46] - This paper explains where the 1 in a billion figure comes from for fingerprint evidence: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1738844

Description #4 [05:44] - My interview with atheist professor Erik Wielenberg where he defends the existence of Objective Morality: https://youtu.be/rACl7ea-jIg

Description #5 [07:30] - The link to Dr. Sharon Street's paper "A Darwinian Dilemma for Realist Theories of Value": https://philpapers.org/rec/STRADD

Description #6 [08:38] - In this video, I explain how our emotions can bypass our reasoning: https://youtu.be/IW7UeZuobJ8

Description #7 [09:05] - The link to Dr. Paul Copan's book "Is God a Moral Monster?": https://amzn.to/371xhlz

Description #8 [09:21] - More of my thoughts on how to respond to alleged Old Testament atrocities: https://capturingchristianity.com/how-to-respond-to-alleged-old-testament-atrocities/

Description #9 [13:00] - The link to a recently published book entitled, "Two Dozen (Or So) Arguments For God": https://amzn.to/2NyMR0l

title: What is the Nature of Probability and How Does it Relate to God?
description:
In this live interview, I talk with Dr. Nevin Climenhaga about the nature of probability. This discussion will be relevant to a lot of conversations about God's existence. Some atheists think that apologists should stop talking about probability, for example, because we can only observe 1 universe.

Dr. Climenhaga's website: https://sites.google.com/site/nevinclimenhaga/home

Dr. Climenhaga's Aeon piece on the nature of probabilities: https://aeon.co/ideas/the-concept-of-probability-is-not-as-simple-as-you-think

Dr. Climenhaga's Twitter: https://twitter.com/NevinClimenhaga

Here is a good intro to interpretations of Probability: https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/probability-interpret/

title: The Historical Evidence for Jesus' Resurrection w/ Dr. Calum Miller & Dr. Max Baker-Hytch
description:
This video features a 3.5 hour discussion between myself (Cameron) and two scholars (Dr. Calum Miller and Dr. Max Baker-Hytch) on the historical evidence for the Resurrection of Jesus. It was originally broadcast as a 5-part podcast series and was formatted into one long episode for YouTube. Enjoy!

Capturing Christianity podcast: https://soundcloud.com/capturingchristianity

Calum's website: https://calumsblog.com/

Max's website: https://oxford.academia.edu/MaxBakerHytch

0:00 ‚Äì Cameron sips coffee + Welcome
1:12 ‚Äì Introduction of Dr. Calum Miller
5:16 ‚Äì Introduction of Dr. Max Baker-Hytch
7:19 ‚Äì Faith Journeys + Prior Probability
14:52 ‚Äì Resource Recommendations 
18:20 ‚Äì Prolegomena to the Evidence
29:37 ‚Äì Approaches to Arguing for the Resurrection
41:03 ‚Äì The Idea of Resurrection in the First Century
45:35 ‚Äì A ‚ÄúSpiritual‚Äù Resurrection?
51:49 ‚Äì Sources for the Resurrection: 1 Cor 15
1:03:41 ‚Äì The Importance of Burial Rituals
1:10:32 ‚Äì The Historical Joseph of Arimathea
1:21:46 ‚Äì Jesus‚Äô Burial Site
1:32:51 ‚Äì The Empty Tomb
1:37:23 ‚Äì The Testimony of Women
1:44:23 ‚Äì Summary of the Burial Accounts of Jesus
1:48:43 ‚Äì Pliny the Younger on the Early Christians
1:53:56 ‚Äì Eye Witnesses + James + Paul + Apostles
2:01:32 ‚Äì Embellishment + Mary Magdalene + Summary of Sources and Witnesses
2:05:07 ‚Äì Alternative Theories on the Resurrection + ‚ÄúThe Disciples Lied‚Äù Theory
2:09:40 ‚Äì ‚ÄúWrong Tomb‚Äù Theory
2:11:49 ‚Äì ‚ÄúSwoon‚Äù (Apparent Death) Theory
2:16:47 ‚Äì ‚ÄúHallucination‚Äù or ‚ÄúGrief Hypothesis‚Äù Theory
2:35:00 ‚Äì Bayes Factor + Weighing the Evidence for Resurrection 
2:55:20 ‚Äì Worst Objections to the Resurrection Hypothesis
2:58:03 ‚Äì Summary of All of the Evidence for the Resurrection
3:11:07 ‚Äì Their New Book on the New Testament

title: Was Jesus Actually Born on December 25? (Dr. Michael Heiser)

title: Why the Puddle Analogy Against God Fails Miserably
description:
In this video, I explain why the Puddle Analogy against the Fine-tuning Argument for God fails (on multiple levels).

#1: The likelihood principle says that ‚Äúif some evidence is more likely on Hypothesis 1 than Hypothesis 2, then that evidence confirms Hypothesis 1 over Hypothesis 2.‚Äù Here‚Äôs a quick example: suppose you‚Äôre playing Poker and the guy to your left has been dealt a Royal Flush the last 5 hands. Being dealt 5 Royal Flushes in a row is likely on the hypothesis that he‚Äôs cheating and unlikely on the hypothesis that he‚Äôs not cheating. This fact therefore provides evidence that he‚Äôs cheating over not cheating. And btw, anybody actually in that situation would (without a doubt) suspect that he‚Äôs cheating.

#2: See number three at this website: http://home.messiah.edu/~rcollins/Fine-tuning/FT.HTM

#3: https://youtu.be/58brbYwN0Q0

#4: (Same link as #3) https://youtu.be/58brbYwN0Q0

#5: Universes by John Leslie: https://amzn.to/2E4PrWP


----------------------------- ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS -----------------------------


Special thanks to the following people for providing insightful feedback and helpful comments to earlier versions of the script: Tomas Bogardus, Josh Rasmussen, Josh Parikh, Luke Barnes, Justin Mooney, Braxton Hunter, Brett Lunn, and Dustin Crummett.

title: DEBATE: The Problem of Evil - Cameron Bertuzzi vs Justin Schieber
description:
Over the course of about 2 months, atheist podcaster Justin Schieber and I engaged in a formal written debate on the Problem of Evil. It gets a little technical at points, so I highly recommend reading the transcript (available on our patreon page here: https://bit.ly/2MCrxYp).

The format of the debate was 15 minute openings, 10 minute rebuttals, and 8 minute closings. We each had up to seven days to issue our responses, ask for clarification, etc. It was originally written and later orated for the August 28th, 2017 episode of the Real Atheology Podcast.

For more info: https://capturingchristianity.com/cameron-bertuzzi-justin-schieber-debate-problem-evil/

0:00:00 Justin's Opening
0:12:13 Cameron's Opening
0:27:09 Justin's First Rebuttal
0:38:20 Cameron's First Rebuttal
0:48:04 Justin's Closing Statement
0:56:50 Cameron's Closing Statement

title: Daniel Dennett vs Alvin Plantinga Debate REMASTERED
description:
This is the remastered and repaired audio from an exchange between Dr. Alvin Plantinga and Dr. Daniel Dennett. The audio was really bad in every iteration I found online, so I had my sound producer Sawyer Hudson doctor it up. The doctored version is still pretty bad but you can at least make out about 98% of what's said.

For a little background on this exchange, Dr. Plantinga was presenting a paper he wrote entitled, "Science and Religion, Where the Conflict Really Lies." Dr. Dennett was tasked with commenting on the paper. That's it. He was tasked with responding to the content. But unfortunately Dennett went way off topic and kind of went on a rant against religious belief. Because of this, to lay audiences it ended up sounding like a debate (even though it wasn't).

Here's an interesting written review of their "debate" from someone that attended the event: https://epistleofdude.wordpress.com/2018/08/05/plantinga-vs-dennett-debate-prosblogion-review/?fbclid=IwAR3uyCaqp90qTKQhDi8hkCQTRHXO1YEy2wuQ4PQtNRZ4kWCGaVEtR8woQI0

title: The Gospel in About a Minute with Dr. Douglas Groothuis
description:
The Gospel can be presented in a variety of ways. Here's how Christian philosopher and scholar Dr. Douglas Groothuis presents it.

Check out all of our 'Gospel in About a Minute' videos featuring leading Christian philosophers and apologists: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL96Nl_XJhQEjko4E40FVlurqWOWEgTQsq

Dr. Groothuis received a PhD and a BS from the University of Oregon, and an MA in philosophy from the University of Wisconsin‚ÄìMadison. He has served as adjunct professor at Seattle Pacific University, visiting instructor in apologetics for Westminster Theological Seminary, and instructor at the University of Oregon .

He is the author of Walking Through Twilight: A Wife‚Äôs Illness‚ÄîA Philosopher‚Äôs Lament, Philosophy in Seven Sentences, Christian Apologetics: A Comprehensive Case for Christian Faith, Unmasking the New Age, Confronting the New Age, Revealing the New Age Jesus, Christianity That Counts, Deceived by the Light, Jesus in an Age of Controversy, The Soul in Cyberspace, Truth Decay, On Pascal, and On Jesus. He has written for scholarly journals such as Religious Studies, Sophia, Research in Philosophy and Technology, Journal of the Evangelical Theological Society, Philosophia Christi, Trinity Journal, and Asbury Theological Journal as well as for numerous popular magazines such as Christianity Today, Moody Magazine, The Christian Research Journal, Christian Counseling Today, Modern Reformation and Perspectives. He has also written editorials for a variety of newspapers.

title: The Euthyphro Dilemma - Matt Flannagan vs Jason Thibodeau
description:
The Euthyphro Dilemma says that either God has reasons for his commands or He doesn‚Äôt. Take the second option. God has no reasons for His commands. Well then God‚Äôs commands are arbitrary‚Äìhowever, morality can‚Äôt be arbitrary. Now take the first option. God has reasons for His commands. Well then these reasons themselves are sufficient to give us moral obligations. No need for God. The Euthyphro Dilemma is meant to show that grounding morality in God is misguided. Jason argues that the Euthyphro Dilemma is sound, Matt argues it is not.

For more info: http://capturingchristianity.com/the-euthyphro-dilemma-matt-flannagan-vs-jason-thibodeau/

title: Answering 5 Big Objections to Christianity with Dr. Jerry Walls
description:
From the Big Bang to Homosexuality to the Problem of Evil, in this interview, Dr. Jerry Walls and I answer some of the hottest objections to Christianity. We couldn't cover everything, so we limited the objections to 5 of the most common we see and hear from culture. They aren't difficult; however, they are the kind of questions that ordinary church people need to really reflect on and think about. Here they are for reference:

1. Evolution/Big Bang proves that Christianity is false. (6:30)
2. People believe in God because of wish fulfillment. (12:50)
3. The Bible seems like it was written by a bunch of uninformed peasants with no scientific knowledge at all. Why should we think that it‚Äôs reliable? (17:29)
4. Christianity is against gay people. (22:05)
5. Why do bad things happen to good people? (28:34)

title: Tyler McNabb Interview (Part 3 of 3) - Abductive Moral Argument for God
description:
Tyler McNabb is an Assistant Professor of Philosophy (Humanities) at Houston Baptist University. His specialization is in epistemology and philosophy of religion. In combining these two topics, his current focus has been on defending both proper functionalism and the project of Reformed Epistemology. In addition to his research, he also enjoys teaching, reading theology, witnessing, watching The Walking Dead, and eating Mexican food.

In Part 3 we discuss an abductive version of the moral argument. We touch on a wide number of subjects rather quickly and succinctly. Buckle up!

For more information: http://capturingchristianity.com/

title: Philosophical Street Preaching with Tyler McNabb
description:
Philosophy professor Tyler McNabb will be sharing tips on how to effectively Street Preach from a philosophical perspective. This is an open forum for Christians to join and ask questions on the topic. Tyler has been street preaching for over a decade. Outside of America, Tyler has done street evangelism in the U.K., Israel, and Central America. One of the ways in which Tyler's approach to evangelism is unique is that he focuses on integrating philosophy into his evangelistic methodology. Tyler is now an assistant professor of philosophy at Houston Baptist University.

For more info: http://capturingchristianity.com/philosophical-street-preaching-tyler-mcnabb/

title: A Positive Case for Annihilationism - Chris Date & Jason Crowder
description:
More info: http://capturingchristianity.com/discussion-positive-case-annihilationism/

This discussion features two Christian guests on the question of the doctrine and nature of hell. Does the Bible teach that hell is eternal separation from God, as is traditionally believed, or is hell something else altogether? Chris Date, an annihilationist, runs a website called Rethinking Hell where he defends a "conditional immortality" perspective. Jason Crowder is a traditionalist, he believes that hell is eternal.

We are discussing a positive case for Chris' view. He argues firstly that the Bible teaches we are not inherently immortal, immortality is a gift from God. And then secondly that the doctrine of the atonement (Christ's atoning work on the cross) makes better sense from an annihilationist point of view.

Rethinking Hell: http://www.rethinkinghell.com

Chris' books: http://www.rethinkinghellbooks.com

Chris' plenary presentation at last year's Rethinking Hell Conference in London: https://youtu.be/ogEoPr4Hupc

Recent discussion between Chris Date and Bobby Conway, the One-Minute Apologist: https://www.youtube.com/user/oneminuteapologist/videos

The Eastern Region ETS Meeting in Lancaster, PA on March 31-April 1, Chris will be presenting a paper: http://www.wordmp3.com/ets

title: The Conditional Premiss of the Moral Argument - Peoples, Rauser, Hannestad, Moore
description:
This discussion features two theists, Glenn Peoples and Randal Rauser, and two atheists, Lance Hannestad and Graham Seth Moore, discussing the conditional premise of the moral argument. All participants affirm the view that moral facts exist and are real, the disagreement is found over the grounding of these moral facts (natural vs supernatural).

The theists contend that God is required to ground moral facts, while the atheists contend the opposite: a satisfactory account of moral ontology can be given purely from a naturalistic perspective.

For more information: http://capturingchristianity.com/discussion-conditional-premiss-moral-argument/

description:

http://capturingchristianity.com/discussion-moral-argument/

For Cory Markum's "Hinge" podcast http://hingepodcast.org/

For Cory's blog on the moral argument: http://www.atheistrepublic.com/blog/cory-markum/god-morality-reloaded

title: Schellenberg's Argument from Hiddenness - Justin Schieber, Blake Giunta, and others
description:
In this Theist/Atheist Discussion, we're tackling the argument from Hiddenness again but this time with a new group. This discussion features atheists and hosts of the Real Atheoloy podcast Justin Schieber and Ben Watkins. The theists are Josh Parikh and Blake Giunta.

Real Atheology: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/real-atheology/id1200545713

The formulation of the argument being discussed is Schellenberg's most recent formulation:

(1) If a perfectly loving God exists, then there exists a God who is always open to a personal relationship with any finite person.

(2) If there exists a God who is always open to a personal relationship with any finite person, then no finite person is ever nonresistantly in a state of nonbelief in relation to the proposition that God exists.

(3) If a perfectly loving God exists, then no finite person is ever nonresistantly in a state of nonbelief  in relation to the proposition that God exists. (from 1, 2)

(4) Some finite persons are or have been nonresistantly in a state of nonbelief in relation to the proposition that God exists.

(5) No perfectly loving God exists. (from 3, 4)

http://www.capturingchristianity.com

title: The Evolutionary Argument Against Naturalism - Stephen Law, Tyler McNabb, and others
description:
This Theist/Atheist Discussion features a number of guests, most notably Tyler McNabb and Stephen Law (who recently had an exchange on Unbelievable? on the subject of Reformed Epistemology). The other guests joining are: Cameron Bertuzzi (myself), Josh Parikh, Perry Hendricks, Brett Lunn, Ben Watkins, Ben Bavar.

The topic of discussion is Alvin Plantinga's (in)famous Evolutionary Argument Against Naturalism. The argument roughly states that the probability our cognitive faculties are reliable given Naturalism & Evolution is low. Hence, the person that believes N&E has a defeater for all of their beliefs, including belief in N&E. Belief in N&E is therefore self-referentially incoherent and cannot rationally be accepted.

Stephen Law - http://stephenlaw.blogspot.com/
Tyler McNabb - Currently teaches at HBU, has published several articles defending Plantinga's work
